news_header: Azad Yousuf Kumar, a 32-year-old from Kashmir, was scammed into joining the Russian army while seeking job opportunities abroad, ending up in the Ukraine war.
news_text: Azad Yousuf Kumar, 32, from Pulwama, Kashmir, sought employment abroad in December 2023 and was lured by a YouTube channel advertising security jobs in Russia. He paid around 130,000 rupees for travel fees, unaware he would end up fighting in the Ukraine war. Kumar faced life-threatening situations and was injured during combat training. After nine months, he returned home, realizing he had been a victim of an employment scam. The Indian government acknowledged that 126 nationals served in the Russian army, with some casualties. Other young men from India also reported similar experiences of being coerced into military service under false pretenses.
